name: UNISON Northern Ireland
goal: UNISON Northern Ireland is the Northern Ireland region of UNISON, a UK wide trade union serving more than 1.3 million members, including over 40,000 members in Northern Ireland.  Our members are full and part time staff providing public services in areas including health and social care; the education and higher education services; local government; youth justice; private companies providing public services; and the community and voluntary sector.  84% of our membership in Northern Ireland are women.  We are represented on the Executive Committee of the Irish Congress of Trade Unions and form an integral part of the wider trade union movement across the island of Ireland.  UNISON Northern Ireland campaigned for a vote to remain in the referendum on the UK's membership of the EU.  Since the referendum result, we have been working alongside our colleagues in the trade union movement and the wider equality and human rights sector in Northern Ireland to seek to protect our peace agreement and our members rights and livelihoods from any negative effects an exit from the EU will bring.
interests: Budget, Consumer Affairs, Development, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, General and Institutional Affairs, Humanitarian Aid, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health
euInitiatives: UNISON Northern Ireland follows all relevant initiatives, policies and legislative developments undertaken by the EU institutions which will impact on workers in Northern Ireland, their families and their communities.
